13,875 KG of Trash Out Of The Ocean | Three Latest System 002 Extractions | The Ocean Cleanup

75 789 vues75 k vues
28 févr. 2022
4,6 k
Je n'aime pas
Partager
Télécharger
Enregistrer
The Ocean Cleanup
The Ocean Cleanup
Validé
209 k abonnés
S'abonner
This is a compilation of the latest three extractions of System 002. The total catch is 55,020kg so far; 1/1500th of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, and a new crew is already on their way back to the Great Pacific Garbage Patch to continue the cleanup. Chapters: 00:00 Underwater inspection of System 002 00:24 Extraction #23, February 14th, 2022 02:35 Extraction #22, February 5th, 2022 04:17 Extraction #21, January 27th, 2022 -- Trash accumulates in five ocean garbage patches, the largest one being the Great Pacific Garbage Patch, located between Hawaii and California. If left to circulate, the plastic will impact our ecosystems, health, and economies. Solving it requires a combination of closing the source, and cleaning up what has already accumulated in the ocean. The ocean is big. Cleaning up the Great Pacific Garbage Patch using conventional methods – vessels and nets – would take thousands of years and tens of billions of dollars to complete. After fleets of The Ocean Cleanup systems are deployed into every ocean gyre, combined with source reduction, The Ocean Cleanup projects to be able to remove 90% of ocean plastic by 2040. -- Make sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel to stay updated: https://bit.ly/371k8sN And follow The Ocean Cleanup on: Facebook: https://bit.ly/2QWgmLQ Twitter: https://bit.ly/2RqHqSk Instagram: https://bit.ly/2st9SKT
